message: Lol not my 7 year old...or my 8 year old. I teach my children and grandchildren to listen, research and think about not just themselves but what us in everyone's best interest. I want my kids to be happy and thoughtful. I am Christian. My youngest son believes in a higher power. He don't agree with me on a lot of things but that is OK. I respect his views. Not everyone will agree with my thinking. I respect that.. We all have a different journey in life we make different decisions based on our beliefs.... God bless

Katie, I am on a long car ride and I just read some people's ignorant comments. Try not to take them personally. I have a horrible chronic physical illness and sometimes to help me through it I just read the comments on news feed and laugh. I think to myself how the hell can some people be so ignorant and judgemental? Lol. Sometimes I will comment, just to try to educate

Travis, that shows about how much research you have done. Please, explain the dozens of old newspaper records reporting 7, 8, 10, and 12 foot skeletons being found by mimers, farmers turning up their land, railroad workers clearing land, and construction crews digging new foundations? Or the MANY skulls that can be found in south America that range from 2-4x the size of the average human skull? Don't be fooled by the things the scientific community hides and shove under the rug in an attempt to protect their own theories and truths.
